oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Display case featuring collection of hatpins worn on Federal and Confederate uniforms
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This case contains several items including a "crossed sabers cavalry insignia" that was located in the Brownsville United Confederate Veterans Museum from the 1890s until it closed in 1929 and an insignia belonging to Private William Wesley Williamson, Company F, 2nd Texas Cavalry. Other items are Federal and include a cavalry insignia for enlisted men, infantry breastplate worn on cartridge box strap, cloth hat pin for officers, and a post Civil War infantry hat device.
